dataset.title: Twelve local floras of European Russia

abstract.para: Twelve local floras of European Russia studied and documented in 2001-2019 by Alexey P. Seregin: Ustya (Arkhangelsk Oblast), Zaseki (Tula Oblast), Polibino (Lipetsk Oblast), Khrenovoye (Voronezh Oblast), Troyeruchitsa (Tver Oblast), Man-Pupu-Ner (Komi Republic), Middle Lyaga (Komi Republic), Utrish (Krasnodar Krai), Yasnaya Polyana (Tula Oblast), Bogolyubovsky Lug (Vladimir Oblast), Tsaritsyno (City of Moscow), Patakino (Vladimir Oblast).

intellectualRights.para: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution (CC-BY) 4.0 License.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: European Russia: Arkhangelsk Oblast, Tula Oblast, Lipetsk Oblast, Voronezh Oblast, Tver Oblast, Komi Republic, Krasnodar Krai, Vladimir Oblast, City of Moscow.

purpose.para: This is a GBIF version of twelve checklists either published as papers in local periodicals in Russian or never published. Published within "Biota of Russia" collection.

gbif.citation: Seregin A (2021). Twelve local floras of European Russia. Version 1.4. Lomonosov Moscow State University. Occurrence dataset https://doi.org/10.15468/35rwhv accessed via GBIF.org on 2022-02-08.

bibliography.citation: Seregin, A.P. and Goryainova, I.N. (2003): Flora sosudistykh rasteniy [Vascular flora]. In: Flora i fauna sredney taygi Arkhangel’skoy oblasti (mezhdurech’e Ust’i i Kokshen’gi) [Flora and fauna of middle taiga of Arkhangelsk Province (watershed surface of the Ust’ya and the Kokshen’ga Rivers)] (Moscow: Geograficheskiy fakul’tet MGU), 11–41 (in Russian).

Seregin, A.P. (2011): Local floras of the Moscow State University zonal practice: 1. Zaseki (Tula Oblast); 2. Polibino (Lipetsk Oblast). Fitoraznoobrazie Vostochnoy Evropy 9, 149–177 (in Russian, with English abstract).

Seregin, A.P. (2015): Local floras of the Moscow State University zonal practice: 3. Khrenovskoy Bor (Voronezh Region); 4 & 5. Additions to the floras of Zaseki (Tula Region) and Polibino (Lipetsk Region). Fitoraznoobrazie Vostochnoy Evropy 9 (2), 42–73 (in Russian, with English abstract).
Seregin, A.P. (2020): Flora of the Troyeruchitsa State Reserve (Tver Oblast, Russia). Fitoraznoobrazie Vostochnoy Evropy 14 (1), 4–31 (in Russian, with English abstract).

Seregin, A.P. (2014): Floristic records from Man-Pupu-Nyor Range and adjacent paths (Pechora-Ilych Reserve, Republic of Komi, Russia). Fitoraznoobrazie Vostochnoy Evropy 8 (2), 97–105 (in Russian, with English abstract).

Suslova, E.G., Kozhin, M.N. and Seregin, A.P. (2015): Spisok sosudistykh rasteniy poluostrova Abrau (ot pos. Sukko do Yuzhnoy Ozereyevki) [A list of vascular plants of Abrau Peninsula (from Sukko to Yuzhnaya Ozereyevka)]. In: Leontyena, O.A. et al. Letnyaya praktika po biogeografii na Zapadnom Kavkaze [Summer field practice on biogeography in Western Caucasus] (Moscow: Geograficheskiy fakul’tet MGU), 112–209 (in Russian).
Seregin, A.P. (2010). A report on geobotanical survey of the historical landscape complex Bogolyubobvsky Meadow - Church of the Intercession on the Nerl (July-August 2010).
Seregin, A.P. (2013). A report on botanical (floristic) survey of the Patakinskaya Grove Nature Sanctuary (Kameshkovsky District, Vladimir Oblast, Russia).
